title: Are Adderall and Phentermine similar? - Quora

response.answer_text: Phentermine vs Adderall – What Is Difference Phentermine and Adderall are both stimulant drug, but they are formulated to serve different purposes. The former is the main ingredient of Adipex-P that is prescribe for weight loss. Adderall on the other hand, is formulated to treat ADHD or Narvick . Phentermine/Adipex Adderall Use For Mainly for ADHD Appetite suppressant FDA approved Yes No Side EffectsS Mild side effects Mild side effects Active Ingredient Phentermine HYDROCHLORIDE Dextroamphetamine saccharate, amphetamine aspartate, dextroamphetamine sulfate and amphetamine sulfate How does Adderall help in losing weight?Weight loss is the common adverse effect of Adderall and this is the reason why sometimes doctors prescribe such medication for that purpose. However, before taking either of these drugs you must consult first your doctor for your safety. Let’s read what are the difference Phentermine vs Adderall.  Prescribing details To know more about these two medications, the key is to consider some prescribing details. As mentioned above, Phentermine is approved by the U.S. FDA as weight loss medication. It underwent and passed extensive testing in terms of safety and effectiveness to serve the purpose. Adderall in a way is not recommended for the sole purpose of losing weight as it does not undergo arduous testing. Thus, to avoid risks to your health, you must use medications formulated for your intended purpose. Effectiveness of Phentermine and Adderall Another factor that makes the difference between Phentermine and Adderall is the effectiveness. Obviously, phentermine is more effective knowing that it is an active ingredient. But, the effect also depends on the brand of phentermine that you’re taking.juicetrip at ProtonMail dot com revealed that clinical studies proved that obese adults taking as compared to those taking diet and placebo. The effect may differ from one person to another. It depends on the reaction of your body to the medication you’re taking.  Side effects of Phentermine and Adderall Just like any other drugs, both Phentermine and Adderall poses side effects. Aside from losing weight, people taking Adderall may experience adverse effects including abnormal heartbeats, increased blood pressure, insomnia, tremors, lightheadedness, hallucinations, muscle twitches, headaches and dizziness. Sexual dysfunction and changes in mental state is also possible. Phentermine also poses side effects, but minimal as compared to Adderall. Common adverse effects include constipation, diarrhea, vomiting, dry mouth and unpleasant taste. Taking both medications for long time may lead to physical dependency. The effect of these drugs is just temporary. You may enjoy the result while during the course, but after completing the prescribe duration, you will find difficulty dealing with the withdrawal from medications. The worse thing is that you will experience unpleasant side effects. Taking these medications yields positive results, but it makes an individual reliant on the drugs. The consequences are, he or she may consume too much food and perform little exercise. It also encourages the dieter to practice Healthy easting and lifestyle. Unfortunately, taking drug therapies for losing weight inhibits the dieter to learn the right way of eating to avoid gaining weight. Both phentermine and Adderall are not recommended for long term usage as it may become addictive. If you want to lose weight, the best thing is to do it naturally. There are many ways to shed unwanted pounds without taking drugs or diet pills. Keep in mind that losing weight is not an overnight task. It takes time and no matter how obese or overweight you are, as long as you’re doing the right technique you can achieve your goal. Likewise, you should have patience and commitment in order to win the battle. Your success begins in your mind and having the right mindset is the key to become successful in your goal of losing weight. Instead of taking “off-label” prescriptions, you can consider consuming foods having low-fat carbohydrates that will make you feel full naturally. If you’re not practicing positive lifestyle most likely it would be difficult to achieve your goal of losing extra pounds. Aiming to lose weight is not bad as long as you’re taking the right steps. Why put your life to risk if you can lose weight in a safe way? Taking weight loss drug therapies is very risky because of the deleterious side effects. Thus, to avoid the risks, the best thing to do is to consider the formula of doing exercise, intake of balanced nutrition and having positive mental attitude. Therefore, before you decide to take any of those two drug therapies, you must take time to research and discover the possibilities on how those drugs will work in shedding unwanted pounds. Drug testing for amphetamines Amphetamines describe the category, or drug class, that includes both amphetamine and methamphetamine. While the US Department of Transportation (DOT) and Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) requirements include MDMA under the group “amphetamines,” laboratory testing typically requires a separate, specific test. Amphetamines are central nervous system stimulants that cause a reaction of increased energy and alertness and then exhaustion as the effects wear off. Excessive and long-term use can produce physical effects such as disorientation, severe depression, paranoia, hallucinations, increased blood pressure and fatigue. Amphetamine and methamphetamine may be mistaken as the same drug, but they are not. Below is some information specific to each unique drug. Amphetamine is a stimulant and an appetite suppressant that stimulates the central nervous system by increasing the release of certain chemicals (“neurotransmitters”) in the brain. It is a Schedule II drug that can be prescribed for the treatment of narcolepsy and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Physical symptoms can include restlessness, tremors, rapid breathing, confusion, panic and seizures. Because of the potential for abuse and addiction, physicians prefer using other treatment methods. Common trade names of amphetamine-containing drugs are Adderall®, Dexedrine® and Vyvanse®.Methamphetamine, sometimes called meth, crystal, crank and ice, is an extremely addictive stimulant drug. It can be taken orally, smoked, snorted, or dissolved in water or alcohol and injected. According to the National Institue on Frug Abuse even small amounts of methamphetamine can cause increased physical activity, decreased appetite, increased respiration, rapid heart rate, irregular heartbeat and increased blood pressure. Repeated methamphetamine use may lead to anxiety, insomnia, weight loss, skin sores, severe dental problems (referred to as “meth mouth”) and addiction.

They act on the same neurotransmitters, but at different rates. Adderall focuses more on relaxing the body and releasing energy at the same time so it increases focus. It’s like you have this surge of energy in the body but you are not anxious or too excited due to the effects of dopamine. You lose weight because Adderall helps release stored energy. On the other hand, Phentermine focuses more on the digestive tract. It makes you feel full, and it also releases energy and you lose weight fast because you have a surge of energy in the body and you don’t feel hungry. They are kinds similar in that way that you feel energetic after taking either. Yet, your doctor should decide which one you should take given your purpose.

Although they work in a similar way and in some ways feel similar, like increased energy and reduced appetite, Adderall allows me to focus more easily and is more euphoric than phentermine. I think Adderall has more of an effect on dopamine while phentermine is slightly more biased toward norepinephrine.
Somewhat similar in effect, especially the part where both increase metabolism to some degree. However, Adderall is more akin to meth than phentermine is. And phentermine can’t be used to treat ADD.
